definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to look upon as dirt/considered worthless

sentences.english: That pigeon was just as dead as a turd.
sentences.chinese: 没错，是杰克，那只鸽子像粪土一样躺在那儿。

sentences.english: So the excrement of earthworm was recommended as covering materials for the ecological restoration of municipal waste landfill sites.
sentences.chinese: 可见蚓粪土宜作垃圾填埋场生态复垦的覆盖材料。

sentences.english: They treat their workers like dirt.
sentences.chinese: 他们把工人看得粪土不如。

sentences.english: These bricks was brought in gold price and sold like dung.
sentences.chinese: 这些砖瓦买进时似黄金，卖出时似粪土。

sentences.english: If we do not make good use of it, is also seen as devaluing .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们不好好利用它，同样是视为粪土的。

sentences.english: He lifts up the poor from the dust and the needy from the ash heap.
sentences.chinese: 从尘埃里提拔弱小的人，由粪土中举扬穷苦的人。

sentences.english: And fear not the words of a sinful man, for his glory is dung, and worms.
sentences.chinese: 不要怕恶人的议论，因为他们的光荣要变成粪土蛆虫。

definition: to look upon as dirt/considered worthless
position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
chaff, husks, distillers' dregs etc (food eaten by the poor)/(fig.) rubbish/junk/(abbr. for 糟糠妻[zao1 kang1 qi1]) wife who goes through the hardships of poverty with her husband
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
lit. measured in cartloads and gallons/fig. by the barrowload (i.e. lots and lots)/innumerable
lit. to love money as much as one's own life (idiom)/fig. avaricious/tightfisted
